---
title: "Environmental Parameters"
format:
  html:
    theme: default
---

**This data set contains environmental parameters: Temp and Salinity, among other environmental parameters.**

# Getting Started

#### Libraries

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
library(ggpubr)
library(lubridate)
```

#### Load Data

```{r}
d1<- read_csv(here("data", "processed_data", "tx_master.csv"))
```

# Cleaning

#### Daily data frame

```{r}
daily<- d1 %>%
  filter(date %in% c(as.Date("2022-07-07"):as.Date("2022-07-19"))) %>%
  filter(!date %in% as.Date('2022-07-10')) %>%
  select(!...1)
```

# Visualization

#### Temperature

```{r}
temp<- daily %>% ggplot() + geom_line(
  aes(
    x = date,
    y = temp,
    color = site),
  size = 1)+
  theme_bw()+
  labs(
    x = "Date",
    y = "Temperature (°C)",
  #  title = "Temperature across Daily Time Series by Site",
    color = "Site")+
  theme(
    plot.title= element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 20),
    axis.title.x = element_blank(),
    axis.ticks.x = element_blank(),
    axis.text.x = element_blank(),
    axis.title.y = element_text(size = 7),
    axis.text.y = element_text(size = 7),
    legend.position = "none",
    legend.background = element_rect(colour = 'black', fill = 'white', linetype='solid')) + #Moves legend onto plot 
    scale_color_manual(values = c("Blind Oso" = "#809C52",
                                "Canals" = "#ba4716",
                                "Gulf" = "4c848c"))
```

                                "Gulf" = "4c848c"))

#### Combine Environment Plots

```{r, fig.width= 10, fig.height= 5}
fig<- ggarrange(cop,temp,sal,sil,do,amm,nn,tn,ortho,doc, pH,don + font("x.text", size = 10), ncol = 4, nrow = 3,align = "v")

fig
```

# Save as PNG

```{r}
png(file = here("results", "plots", "temp_sal.png"))
fig
dev.off()
```
